title: Rhizome AI: Product Engineer / AI Engineer (Contractor)
description:
Headquarters: New York, NY
    
URL: http://rhizomeai.com


As a Product Engineer, you'll work across our full stack to improve the user experience and expand our platform's capabilities. Your work will directly impact how life science companies navigate regulatory requirements.
What You'll Work On
Enhancing UI/UX across our platform
Integrating new datasets to expand regulatory coverage
Improving our data ingestion pipelines
Improve our RAG pipeline‚Äôs document retrieval
Improve our answer generation pipeline¬†
Building internal apps that help domain experts tune our agentic capabilities
Opportunity to engage directly with customers (if interested)
Opportunity to work on AI engineering projects (if interested)
Tech Stack
Next.js (Pages Router)
React
Tailwind CSS
PostgreSQL
Digital Ocean
Python + Fastapi¬†
Requirements
4+ years of relevant software engineering experience
Strong experience with our tech stack
High ownership mindset and ability to work independently
5 hours of overlap with GMT-5 (Eastern Time) required
Fully remote
Able and willing to travel for a 1 week offsite every 1-3 months
Our Work Culture
Async, written-first communication with minimal meetings
Ship quickly and iterate
High autonomy and trust
Compensation & Commitment
$30 - $60/hour depending on experience
Initially 20 hours/week with potential to scale to 40 hours/week
Contractor position
To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/rhizome-ai-product-engineer-ai-engineer-contractor

title: ZSA: C and Rust dev with a love of keyboards, quality, and small teams
description:
Headquarters: Kitchener-Waterloo, Ontario, Canada
    
URL: https://zsa.io


Are you an embedded C programmer who also enjoys system programming in Rust? Do you like working as part of a small team with deep technical expertise and having lots of impact on hardware development? And finally, do you enjoy a good keyboard?
If so, I'd love to talk to you. I'm Erez, and I run ZSA. We make nice keyboards (the ErgoDox EZ, Moonlander, and Voyager) and we've got lots of ideas. We're also passionate about open-source and have been contributing to the QMK open-source keyboard project for many years, and have open-sourced other work as well.
We're small, bootstrapped, and fully remote. We're a company of grownups ‚Äî no invasive monitoring, and meetings only as needed, no exhausting daily video standups.¬†
We do use a kanban system and create detailed work items, so requirements are not going to shift under your feet. We also listen to what you think. Our process is collaborative, and the right person for this role will have a big impact on our small business, and possibly on the keyboard community far outside of ZSA as well.
If this sounds interesting, the link goes to a Typeform I'd love for you to fill out. We don't look at resumes, but the Typeform isn't boring, I promise. Check it out, and thank you for your time! ‚ù§Ô∏è
To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/zsa-c-and-rust-dev-with-a-love-of-keyboards-quality-and-small-teams

title: DesignFiles: Remote Front-End Rails Developer
description:
Headquarters: Remote
    
URL: https://designfiles.co


At DesignFiles, we‚Äôre looking for a Front-End Rails Developer with strong JavaScript and UI skills to help shape and improve the creative tools at the heart of our platform.
About Us:
At DesignFiles, we‚Äôre building the go-to platform for interior designers to manage every part of their business‚Äîfrom concept to completion. More than 5,500 customers already rely on our tools, and our remote team of 30+ is growing. If you care about building great products that solve real problems, we‚Äôd love to meet you.
What You'll Do:
Help guide the evolution of our Design/Presentation Editor into a modern, Canva-style experience that supports moodboards, room mock-ups, client presentations, reusable templates, and more.
Build intuitive, high-performance UI components for core editing interactions: drag-and-drop, layering, resizing, grouping, alignment, snapping, canvas navigation, and on-canvas text/image editing.
Collaborate closely with product and design to translate complex user needs into seamless creative workflows.
Shape the architecture and structure of our editor so it's fast, scalable, and easy to maintain as it grows.
Contribute to a high-quality, design-forward experience that feels just as good as tools like Canva or Figma ‚Äî but purpose-built for interior designers.
Participate in team rituals like daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospectives.
What We're Looking For:
Strong vanilla JavaScript skills, including DOM/event handling, canvas or SVG rendering, and performance optimization.
Experience building or contributing to visual editors, creative tools, or browser-based design software is a strong plus.
Deep understanding of CSS, with hands-on experience using Tailwind or a similar utility-first framework.
Proficient with Stimulus.js, Turbo, Hotwire, ViewComponents, and the modern Rails front-end stack.
3+ years of hands-on Ruby on Rails development experience.
Takes full ownership of features from concept to deployment‚Äîdriving high-quality, scalable implementations.
Fluent English and clear, professional communication skills.
¬†
This is a full-time, 40-hour/week remote contract role. We‚Äôre specifically seeking candidates (not agencies) based within ¬±2 hours of Central European Time (CET).
If you‚Äôve built or contributed to browser-based editors or creative tools‚Äîand care about crafting fast, intuitive, design-friendly experiences‚Äîwe‚Äôd love to talk.
¬†
To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/designfiles-remote-front-end-rails-developer

title: DesignFiles: Remote Growth Engineer (Full-Stack Rails)
description:
Headquarters: Remote
    
URL: https://designfiles.co


At DesignFiles, we‚Äôre looking for a Growth Engineer with strong full-stack Rails experience to join our product engineering team.
About Us:
At DesignFiles, we‚Äôre building the go-to platform for interior designers to manage every part of their business‚Äîfrom concept to completion. More than 5,500 customers already rely on our tools, and our remote team of 30+ is growing. If you care about building great products that solve real problems, we‚Äôd love to meet you.
What You'll Do:
As a Growth Engineer, you‚Äôll sit at the intersection of engineering, product, and growth. You‚Äôll ship features and run experiments that directly impact customer activation, retention, and monetization. Your work won‚Äôt just be about building‚Äîit‚Äôll be about measuring, iterating, and optimizing.
Run experiments that improve activation, retention, and monetization.
Collaborate with product, design, and marketing to test and refine onboarding flows, funnels, and client engagement touchpoints.
Use data to uncover friction points in the user journey and ship small, high-impact improvements.
Take ownership of experiments end-to-end: scope, build, ship, measure, and iterate.
Refine existing features to boost adoption and stickiness.
Contribute to a culture of clean code, rapid iteration, and measurable outcomes.
Participate in team rituals like daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospectives.
What We're Looking For:
5+ years of hands-on Ruby on Rails experience with strong full-stack skills.
Proficiency with JavaScript, Stimulus.js, CSS, RSpec, SQL, Docker, Unix Shell.
Experience with A/B testing, growth-focused engineering, and/or optimizing onboarding funnels.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to self-unblock.
Fluent English and solid communication skills.
Team-oriented and comfortable with collaboration, idea-sharing, and code reviews.

This is a full-time, 40-hour/week remote contract role. We‚Äôre specifically seeking candidates (not agencies) based within ¬±2 hours of Central European Time (CET).
If you‚Äôve got a portfolio of high-impact experiments or user-facing improvements you‚Äôve shipped and iterated on, we‚Äôd love to talk.
¬†
To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/designfiles-remote-growth-engineer-full-stack-rails

title: Apexver: Quantitative Research Team Lead
description:
Headquarters: Cayman
    
URL: http://apexver.com


Location: Remote
Compensation: Base Salary ‚Ç¨180,000 / year + performance bonus up to 100%
Team: Quantitative Research & Trading Strategy
¬†
Role Overview
As the Quantitative Research Team Lead, you will head a team of quants and researchers dedicated to developing trading strategies, improving alpha models, and optimizing execution. This role is both hands-on research and strategic leadership: you will drive model development, oversee research pipelines, and mentor team members while shaping Apexver‚Äôs research roadmap.
You will partner with traders, engineers, and data scientists to push the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible in high-frequency and systematic trading.
Key Responsibilities
Leadership & Strategy
Lead, mentor, and grow a team of quantitative researchers.
Define research priorities, align with trading and technology strategy, and ensure results deliver measurable alpha.
Instill best practices for model development, testing, and deployment.
Research & Innovation
Develop and refine alpha models, statistical arbitrage signals, and systematic trading strategies.
Explore large-scale datasets to identify patterns, anomalies, and predictive signals.
Partner with engineers to translate research into robust, production-ready systems.
Collaboration & Execution
Work closely with traders and risk managers to integrate models into execution pipelines.
Collaborate with infrastructure teams to optimize simulation environments, backtesting frameworks, and data feeds.
Balance short-term opportunities with long-term research initiatives.
Qualifications
Required:
7+ years of experience in quantitative research / systematic trading, with at least 2+ years in a leadership capacity.
Advanced degree (PhD strongly preferred, MSc acceptable) in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Statistics, or related quantitative discipline.
Deep experience with time-series analysis, probability, statistics, and machine learning methods.
Strong programming skills in Python (for research) and familiarity with C++ (for production alignment).
Proven track record of delivering profitable trading strategies or alpha models.
Strong leadership, communication, and ability to align a multi-disciplinary team.
Nice to Have:
Background in high-frequency trading (HFT) or market-making.
Expertise in market microstructure, execution algorithms, or exchange connectivity.
Experience managing petabyte-scale datasets and distributed research pipelines.
Comfort with risk management frameworks and capital allocation.
Why Join Apexver?
Compensation & upside: ‚Ç¨180k base salary + up to 100% performance bonus.
Impact: Shape the research direction of a fast-growing proprietary trading firm.
Collaboration: Work alongside elite engineers and traders on high-stakes challenges.
Innovation: Freedom to test ideas quickly, deploy models, and iterate in production.
Culture: Flat, collaborative, and meritocratic environment where best ideas win.
Application
If you are excited to lead a world-class research team, love solving problems where milliseconds and insights matter, and want to directly impact the future of Apexver‚Äôs trading business ‚Äî we‚Äôd love to talk to you.
¬†
To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/apexver-quantitative-research-team-lead

title: Mobena: Frontend Engineer
description:
Headquarters: New York, NY
    
URL: https://mobena.co/


Mobena is a three-person, remote-first startup building the ‚Äúevolution‚Äù of multi-generational tax/estate planning software, targeting the advisors of America‚Äôs 2 million wealthiest families. We‚Äôre currently hiring our first dedicated UI Engineer to ‚Äúown‚Äù the frontend of our flagship product, Mobena Evolution, for which we have little to no frontend code. You‚Äôll work directly with our backend/algorithm-focused CTO, as well as our designer-founder, to turn evolving Figma concepts into fast, maintainable, and scalable user interfaces.
What You‚Äôll Do
Choose and justify the frameworks and tools that best fit our needs.
We have some holdover prototype code in Vite JS, but you can take it or leave it; all of our Figma concepts are new.
The backend is a standard HTTP API. We are open to everything from established web stacks (React, Angular, Svelte, Vite) to cross-platform or native solutions (Qt, WASM, .NET MAUI, Tauri, Electron, Tk)‚Äîliterally anything, if you can convince us it‚Äôs the right choice.
Build our UI from the ground up, establishing clear, maintainable patterns for components, state management, styling, testing, performance, and accessibility.
Collaborate to refine and sometimes re-frame existing screen designs in Figma.
Connect the frontend to our APIs (REST, GraphQL, or similar).
Lay groundwork for future mobile clients; however, experience in this regard is a plus rather than a requirement.
About You
You‚Äôve shipped an interactive application‚Äîweb, desktop, or mobile‚Äîvia coursework, open source, side project or professional work.
You care about usability and design quality. (That is, you care about the user.)
You learn by doing: building things rather than sitting in committee.
You are happy to say I don‚Äôt know. We try to cultivate ‚Äúbeginner‚Äôs mind‚Äù at Mobena‚Äîit helps us avoid conventional traps and groupthink. The first step of thinking like a beginner is acknowledging your own ignorance! üòä
You can defend your technical choices in clear English, and can take credit for your successes as well your mistakes.
You are comfortable in an early-stage, collaborative environment.
To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/mobena-frontend-engineer

title: Proxify AB: Senior Backend Developer (Node.js / Nest.js)
description:
Headquarters: Sweden
    
URL: http://career.proxify.io


The Role:
¬†
We are looking for a Senior Backend (Node.js / Nest.js) Developer to join our fast-growing network. You‚Äôll be responsible for building modern and scalable web applications, working closely with backend developers and designers to create intuitive user experiences.
This is a long-term, full-time remote role with opportunities to work on innovative projects that make a difference.
¬†
What we‚Äôre looking for:
¬†
5+ years with Node.js and 3+ past years with Nest.js
Strong expertise in Node.js and Nest.js frameworks.
Proven experience building REST and/or GraphQL APIs.
Strong knowledge of JavaScript (ES6+) and TypeScript.
Solid experience with relational and/or NoSQL databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB).
Familiarity with authentication/authorization mechanisms (JWT, OAuth2).
Experience with unit/integration testing (e.g., Jest, Mocha).
Proficiency with Git and version control workflows.

¬†
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.
Understanding of event-driven architecture and message brokers (e.g., RabbitMQ, Kafka).
Experience with Docker and containerized applications.
Knowledge of microservices and serverless architectures.

Responsibilities:
¬†
Design and develop robust, scalable, and secure backend applications using Node.js and Nest.js.
Implement RESTful APIs, GraphQL endpoints, and microservices architectures.
Optimize application performance, scalability, and maintainability.
Integrate with databases (SQL/NoSQL) and external services via APIs.
Ensure code quality, security, and compliance with industry standards.
